result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio C Tadych was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 35 days was granted, if imposed. Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week)

Maintain a valid Driver's License

No new law violations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Cash bail applied to costs. Remaining balance to be paid as a condition of probation. 

Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Narcotics and Vice Unit.

timeConds.notes: Huber with release for work, work search, work training and treatment. Defendant to report to the Huber Facility on 08-19-2022 by 06:00 PM.

Sentence credit of 35 days is granted, if imposed. Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio C Tadych

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Hughes advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Antonio C Tadych in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Antonio C Tadych. 
Case called for sentencing hearing.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 2:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 35 days if revoked).  CONCURRENT with Count 3
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy
-	Inform agent of all prescriptions;
-	Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week);
-	Maintain a valid Driver's License;
-	No new law violations;

Condition Time: 6 Months Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH, WORK TRAINING AND TREATMENT - To commence 8/19/22 by 6:00 pm.

BUY MONEY: $645.00 to be paid to City of Waukesha Narcotics and Vice Unit

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining financial obligations to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.


Count 3:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
5 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 35 days if revoked).  CONCURRENT with Count 2
-	3 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	Same as Count 2

Condition Time: 90 Days Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH, WORK TRAINING AND TREATMENT - STAYED to be used at the Agent's discretion.

COSTS:  $ 268.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  Cash bail to be applied.  Any remaining financial obligations to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed.

11:48 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Antonio C Tadych in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed.  Atty. Hughes confirms and his client is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing today.  Court notes due to a calendar conflict it inquires if parties could come back this afternoon for this matter.  Atty. Hughes would prefer to proceed with a plea only and adjourn for sentencing. Court will proceed with a plea only today and adjourn for sentencing.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Hughes confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 & 3, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3.  Court orders Count 1 dismissed and read in.  Court adjourns for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Antonio C Tadych in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:20 AM Defendant Antonio C Tadych in court by zoom video with attorney Steven Hughes, in person.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Detainer Lift
Hearing on May 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Request for defendant to appear by zoom.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 04-21-2022. Granted.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
filed, to be produced from Walworth County Jail.
Detainer placed at: Walworth Co Jail

ADDRESS INFO for Antonio C Tadych
Current: P.O Box 1004, C/O Walworth Co Jail, Elkhorn, WI 53121 United States  (Effective: 04-15-2022)
Prior: 8885 South 68th St, c/o Milwaukee House of Corrections, Franklin, WI 53132 United States

09:23 AM Attorney Steven Hughes in court.   Defendant Antonio C Tadych did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Hughes is waiving time limits and asking for an adjournment as the defendant was not produced.  The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing.  The Court confirmed the defendant is currently at the Walworth County Jail.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Walworth County Jail.  If Walworth County Jail will not release the defendant, the parties will stipulate that the preliminary hearing can be conducted by Zoom.  The Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom for the preliminary hearing, as a last resort, if Walworth County Jail will not produce the defendant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Unable to forward
Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee House of Corrections

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:20 PM Defendant Antonio C Tadych appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Milwaukee House of Corrections with attorney Steven Hughes who appeared by Zoom.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee HOC.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
